topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ab86fb6368726872290200#post_53ab86fb6368726872290200
The problem there is the cost. There is a reason most porn games are the labor of love of one or two individuals instead of an actual thriving industry and that is that it is prohibitively expensive to make a video game and it is much, much more economical just to make videos or draw images than it is to make a pornographic vr experience worth spending money on.

Oh there will probably be one or two attempts, but I doubt it will be anything beyond the purely vanilla.

topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ab888963687269718e0200#post_53ab888963687269718e0200
[bq="gasmaskangel"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ab86fb6368726872290200#post_53ab86fb6368726872290200
The problem there is the cost. There is a reason most porn games are the labor of love of one or two individuals instead of an actual thriving industry and that is that it is prohibitively expensive to make a video game and it is much, much more economical just to make videos or draw images than it is to make a pornographic vr experience worth spending money on.

Oh there will probably be one or two attempts, but I doubt it will be anything beyond the purely vanilla.[/bq]
Or it'll be a cluster fuck of multiple open source projects that will be a trainwreck under the hood but most people won't realize how much of a trainwreck it is and play them anyhow.

What I mean by this is chances are someone's going to make the core architect of a porn game without anything else on it and then people are going to mod it until it crashes.  What's probably going to wind up happening is someone's going to make a "game" that is programming wise a trainwreck then all the "content" will just have a "mod" folder.

I can imagine it now, "Try the new sex simulator VR, over 10000 mods!* (Warning many of these mods do not actually work/were only half done and many of them have contradictions in their programming and thus 95% of them can not work together)"

And the motto of the "game" will be "mod it till it crashes".  Whatever will the "game" will be it will start out as a trainwreck and take years until it's fully functional.

topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ab8ced63687268ea290400#post_53ab8ced63687268ea290400
[bq="gasmaskangel"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ab8bba63687267ec620400#post_53ab8bba63687267ec620400
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ab8c346368726881630400#post_53ab8c346368726881630400
It will be an interesting experiement none the less, and honestly I'll probably get it since I do rather pride myself on being an enormous perv.

My point is more that I don't see it actually becoming an industry the way porn has on the internet.[/bq]
Yeah; I totally agree here; it's not going to become a industry so much as a clusterfuck of open source projects that while will be extremely popular there will be no money in it.



To use a analogy and I know it's not a porn game and it's a actual game, but look at minecraft mods; 95% of them are clusterfucks of lack of programming skill and have many redundant items in it with little to no actual use, BUT it hasn't stopped anyone from making their "perfect" mod so far.

What is probably going to wind up happening is bare bones "game" that a company makes where all the actual gameplay is solely through mods.  In other words a "game" where if you don't load any mods in all that is really going to show up is the title screen with a screen saying, "please load mods".
